result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee W. Lameer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 dtp or 15 days KCJ or 15 days work crew.

records.addlTxt:
Amended - Wrong fine schedule used in court - DRGOD Surcharge
$750 due in 30 days or 15 Days KCJ or 15 days work crew.
Amended Info
Restitution Determined by DA  - $112,733.22.
For Restitution Order
$740 due in 30 days or 15 days KCJ or 15 days work crew.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jennifer Severino.  Victim rights compliance - victims present.  Defense counsel reports she has a cashier's check w/her today for the full amount of restitution.  Amended misd. information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to the amended charge; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft fined $500 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 15 days work crew or 15 days KCJ.  Restitution ordered; Atty Severino turned over the check to the victims in court.  Court waives the 10% restitution surcharge.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jennifer Severino.  Defense counsel moves for a short adjournment; case is resolved.  Offer contemplates deft paying $112K in restitution upfront; state will amend to misdemeanors.  FPT set for 8/7/15 @ 10:30am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jennifer Severino.  Defense requests an adjournment due to medical issues; no objection by the State.  FPT adj to 7/13/15 @ 2pm, JS 8/24/15 @ 9am
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Severino.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Severino.  Brief arguments heard on deft's motion to dismiss; motion denied for the reasons set forth on the record.  Defense moves for an adjournment; there are voluminous documents which need to be reviewed.  State has no objection.  Court is hostile to a lengthly adjournment but will grant a short adjournment.  FPT adj to 6/4/15 @ 1:45pm, JS 7/13/15 @ 9am.
of Lee Lameer in Support of Motion to Dismiss Based on Pre-charging Delay

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Severino.  Arguments heard on deft's motion to dismiss; State objects to the motion.  Motion taken under advisement; Court will allow defense counsel to supplement her pleadings by filing an affidavit - affidavit shall be filed at least 10 days prior to the FPT.  Mutual request for an adjournment - FPT adj to 4/24/15 @ 9am, JS 5/11/15 @ 9am
of Hrg date
Scheduling Order

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Jennifer Severino.  Clerk K. ZIrbel.  Defense motion based on pre-charging delay deferred to the trial Court.  Defense motion to dismiss due to defective complaint heard; Court denies motion to dismiss.  KSD Det. Troy Barnett testified on behalf of the State.  Upon completion of testimony the Court found probable cause; bound over to Br. 3.  Information filed, plea of not guilty entered.  FPT 1/30/15 at 10:00.  JS 2/16/15 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
